intro: Hieracium scissicauloides, commonly known as the cut-stem hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, blooming from June to August. Hieracium scissicauloides is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is considered an invasive species in some regions.
